newsitem.title: USA: Bally Total Fitness new member revenue up.
newsitem.headline: Bally Total Fitness new member revenue up.

text.p: Bally Total Fitness Holding Corp said Wednesday that new membership revenues for the first quarter rose to $114.9 million from $112.4 million, the first such increase in 10 quarters.
Earlier, Bally Total Fitness reported first quarter earnings of $0.19 a share, compared with a year-ago loss of $0.20 a share.
Excluding a provision for doubtful receivables, operating costs and expenses for the first quarter decreased $2.8 million or two percent from 1996 levels.
"The improved results for the quarter are a sign the core business of operating fitness center facilities is solid," Lee Hillman, president, said in a statement.
"Returning Bally Total Fitness to profitability this quarter represents an important step for the company," he added.
Bally Total Fitness operates 320 facilities in 27 states and Canada.
